title: Exception in JUnit Extension When Using Parameterized Test With Records
body:
### Describe the bug

A parameterized JUnit 5 test that accepts a record as a parameter causes an exception in the Quarkus JUnit extension.

```
[ERROR] Errors: 
[ERROR]   ExampleResourceTest.testHelloEndpoint(Example)[1] Â» Conversion 
---- Debugging information ----
cause-exception     : java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
cause-message       : can't get field offset on a record class: private final java.lang.String com.example.Example.message
class               : com.example.Example
required-type       : com.example.Example
converter-type      : com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ReflectionConverter
path                : /com.example.Example/message
line number         : 2
version             : 1.4.20
-------------------------------

```

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### How to Reproduce?

[quarkus-parameterized-test-records.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/12811380/quarkus-parameterized-test-records.zip)
